Vendetta

As champion of the Colosseo and a member of Italy’s elite, Vendetta will stop at nothing to reclaim the throne of her family’s criminal empire. Known for her explosive rage and ruthlessness in battle, the only thing that exceeds her skill in physical combat is her boundless ambition.

Damage

Rome, Italy

Feb 15 (Age: 29)

Abilities

Palatine FangWarding StanceWhirlwind DashSoaring SliceProjected EdgeSundering Blade

Palatine Fang

Hard-light greatsword. Combo swings to end with a destructive overhead slash.

Warding Stance

Block with your sword, reducing frontal damage and deflecting melee attacks. Blocking damage depletes energy.

Whirlwind Dash

Rush forward into a circular slash.

Soaring Slice

Hurl your sword in the direction you are facing and then fly to it.

Projected Edge

Available while Warding Stance is active. Consume energy to fire a wide projectile.

Sundering Blade

Cleave through most defenses, dealing severe damage to enemies in front of you.

Keys displayed are defaults for PC. They are configurable in game.

Stadium Powers

Stadium Powers are ability-changing upgrades obtainable in the Armory. Each hero has 12 unique Powers to choose from.

Rising Rampage

Onslaught's maximum stacks increases by 1 after earning 2 Eliminations, up to 3.

Continuum

Before dying, temporarily come back to life with 15% Max Life per each Onslaught stack and become hindered. (90s Cooldown)

Skycut

After blocking ranged damage, the next Overhead swing shoots a Projected Edge with 50% damage.

Overloaded Strike

After using Soaring Slice, holding Overhead swing in air can channel level 1 Sundering Blade with 25% increased damage.

Defiance Core

Warding Stance energy regenerates now even while blocking at 75% rate.
For every Projected Edge fired, reduce Whirlwind Dash and Soaring Slice cooldown by 0.7s.

Riposte

After blocking ranged damage, remove Warding Stance move speed penalty. Vendetta's next swing becomes an overhead swing.

Cyclone Charge

Whirlwind Dash can spin up to 3s for 50% damage.

Double Dash

After Whirlwind Dash is finished, it can be reactivated within 3s for 50% damage.

Up and Over

Using Soaring Slice gives 35% of missing life as Overhealth for 10s.

Exalted Empress

After using Soaring Slice, Overhead strike and Sundering Blade give 30% of damage as temporary Overhealth, up to 100.

Cataclisma

Projected Edge explodes on enemy hit, dealing 20 damage to enemies within 4m.

Furious Friction

Warding Stance has 50% increased energy regeneration rate.

Rising Rampage

Onslaught's maximum stacks increases by 1 after earning 2 Eliminations, up to 3.

Continuum

Before dying, temporarily come back to life with 15% Max Life per each Onslaught stack and become hindered. (90s Cooldown)

Skycut

After blocking ranged damage, the next Overhead swing shoots a Projected Edge with 50% damage.

Overloaded Strike

After using Soaring Slice, holding Overhead swing in air can channel level 1 Sundering Blade with 25% increased damage.

Defiance Core

Warding Stance energy regenerates now even while blocking at 75% rate.
For every Projected Edge fired, reduce Whirlwind Dash and Soaring Slice cooldown by 0.7s.

Riposte

After blocking ranged damage, remove Warding Stance move speed penalty. Vendetta's next swing becomes an overhead swing.

Cyclone Charge

Whirlwind Dash can spin up to 3s for 50% damage.

Double Dash

More on Stadium

Story

As the daughter of Talon boss Antonio Bartalotti, Marzia was born to power. But when Blackwatch killed her father, she was forced out of the empire he had built and lost claim to her inheritance. Driven by spite, she trained to become “Vendetta”: a famous champion and ‘heel’ in Rome's gladiator games. Merciless, cunning, and willing to do whatever it takes to succeed, Vendetta cultivated her fame to forge a network of powerful allies in and out of the Colosseo. Having finally caught the attention of Talon, she now seeks to reclaim the throne of the empire that is rightfully hers and build it back stronger.

BORN TO POWER

Growing up, Marzia Bartalotti was promised great power. Her father, known by most as Antonio Bartalotti, was a notorious arms dealer and a key figure in Talon who instilled in her a sense of pride around her heritage and encouraged her ambition. But even in her youth, Marzia was temperamental. She found few friends among her peers and clashed with her father about the consequences of his decisions on her life—including the loss of her mother at a young age. Frustrated that Antonio’s hubris might put her own future at risk, Marzia studied his business, preparing herself to inherit his empire.

When Antonio was assassinated by a team of Blackwatch agents, Marzia’s worst fears came true. With her father gone and his dealings exposed, she was pushed out of Talon. The assets she was set to inherit were seized by her father’s right hand, Augusto Vialli, and Doomfist refused to grant Marzia her father's council seat. Tired of being underestimated, she set herself on the path to reclaiming her birthright by force.

COLOSSEO'S CHAMPION

Driven by spite and determined to prove her worth, Marzia dedicated herself to training to become a fighter in the Colosseo’s gladiator games: a pageant sport that had become a cultural touchstone in the wake of the Crisis. She wanted all of Italy to know what she was capable of. She set out to be feared and respected for her strength, with grand plans to dominate her enemies inside and outside the arena.

With her persistence, natural skill, and cutthroat persona, Marzia became “Vendetta”. In the Colosseo, she doggedly competed in all manner of competition and seized victory every time. Outside of the games, she grew her wealth and built connections across Italy. In time, she earned the title of Colosseo Champion and became known across Italy as La Lupa Della Ritorsione: “The Wolf of Retribution”.

NOTORIOUS RISE

Colosseo sponsorships became business partnerships; fame meant invitations to private events with Europe’s elite; and gambling and rigged matches behind the scenes at the Colosseo gave her a wealth of information to use as blackmail. Many newcomers to the Colosseo idolized Vendetta’s relentless nature and swore to follow her lead.

Through it all, she kept her eye on Talon, watching as Vialli led it to ruin and Doomfist failed to capitalize on its potential. After careful planning, Vendetta used her influence to seize back some of her father’s territory and take out a Talon council member as a message, proving that her ambition would not rest.

Vendetta’s quest for power is transparent; among the members of Talon, there is no shortage of controversy surrounding her growing influence. As she fights to build her own empire, she has forged powerful allegiances that position her to be a threat not just to Talon, but the entire world.
